channel.title: CVE Feed for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management
channel.description: The latest CVEs for IBM -- Maximo Asset Management

item.title: CVE-2022-41734|2024-08-03T12:49:43.739Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 and 7.6.1.3 could allow a remote attacker to obtain sensitive information when a detailed technical error message is returned in the browser. This information could be used in further attacks against the system. IBM X-Force ID: 237587.

item.title: CVE-2022-22436|2024-08-03T03:14:55.102Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 224164.

item.title: CVE-2022-35645|2024-08-03T09:36:44.454Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1, 7.6.1.2, 7.6.1.3 and IBM Maximo Application Suite 8.8 and 8.9 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 230958.

item.title: CVE-2022-22435|2024-08-03T03:14:55.190Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session.

item.title: CVE-2022-35281|2024-08-03T09:36:44.163Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1, 7.6.1.2, 7.6.1.3 and the IBM Maximo Manage 8.3, 8.4 application in IBM Maximo Application Suite are vulnerable to CSV injection. IBM X-Force ID: 2306335.

item.title: CVE-2022-40616|2024-08-03T12:21:46.260Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.1, 7.6.1.2, and 7.6.1.3 could allow a user to bypass authentication and obtain sensitive information or perform tasks they should not have access to. IBM X-Force ID: 236311.

item.title: CVE-2022-43866|2024-08-03T13:40:06.870Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1.2 and 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 239436.

item.title: CVE-2022-35714|2024-08-03T09:44:21.532Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Asset Management 7.6.1 is vulnerable to cross-site scripting. This vulnerability allows users to embed arbitrary JavaScript code in the Web UI thus altering the intended functionality potentially leading to credentials disclosure within a trusted session. IBM X-Force ID: 231116.

item.title: CVE-2024-27266|2024-07-12T21:03:25.446Z -- ibm -- maximo%20asset%20management
item.description: IBM Maximo Application Suite 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity Injection (XXE) attack when processing XML data. A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to expose sensitive information or consume memory resources. IBM X-Force ID: 284566.

item.description: IBM Maximo Application Suite 7.6.1.3 is vulnerable to stored cross-site scripting.
